text.section: A certification expires on the first anniversary of its effective date unless the certification is renewed for a 1-year term as provided in this section.

At least 1 month before a certification expires, the Department shall send to the certified water quality laboratory, by first-class mail to the last known address of the water quality laboratory, a renewal notice that states:
The date on which the current certification expires;
The date by which the renewal application must be received by the Department for the renewal to be issued and mailed before the certification expires; and
The amount of the renewal fee.

Before the certification expires, the certified water quality laboratory may renew its certification for an additional 1-year term if the water quality laboratory:
Otherwise is entitled to be certified;
Pays to the Department the renewal fee set by the Department; and
Submits to the Department a renewal application on the form that the Department requires.
The Department shall renew the certification of each water quality laboratory that meets the requirements of this subtitle.
